text: Hey <@U2H3TT8F2>! Is your discrtintion here between someone getting into formatting/html and the actual writer? Or is it an initial writer and maybe a final proofreader?

It would be initial writer then final proofreader. So your flow would be:
1 - User/Contributor writes post then clicks submit for approval
2 - Editor makes their edits/spellchecks/grammar and so on, then either publishes it or saves it and notifies user/contributor to make additional edits.

Could probably do step 2 as:  If editor dissapproves, then you get a modal with a place to send a message to the user/contributor for updates to make and then they can resubmit after making changes
also giving us the ability for the user/contributor to only see their own posts when they go to blog would be useful as well
for example, on the GDD site, I can go into other people blogs if I wanted to (cant publish changes as i dont have that permission, but I could go in and edit stuff if i was ever inclined to do so).
